|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = ARM |cpu1_type_rev = XScale |cpu1spd = 266 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Intel;E28F640J3A-120; |flash1size = 8 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = Dynachips;D98SD12816AH-6; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Kendin;KS8995M; |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 00:12:17,00:1A:70 |oui = 00:12:17,00:1A:70 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = Mini PCI |exp_minipci_num = 1 |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, 9-pin header |jtag = yes,, 20-pin header,, J2 |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bg |defaulip = |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = |defaultssid = |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = |manuf = Gemtek |manuf_model = WX5715 |manuf_rev = V01 |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 08/01/2003 |estreldate = 03/2004 |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B0000AR8Z1 |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = Taiwan |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = |rad1modif = Mini PCI |rad1chip1 = Intersil;ISL3880; |rad1chip2 = Intersil;ISL3686A; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL,RP-SMA |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The CPU is part FWIXP425AB. Additional FCC IDs of Q87-HGA7S-3 (Linksys HGA7S, high gain antenna) and Q87-HGA5S-3 (Linksys HGA5S, high gain antenna) The default SSID may be '''linksys-g'''. {{WiFiCert|W001244|04/29/2004}} {{See also|Linksys WRV54G|Gemtek}} ==Links of Interest== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=194273 Pictures on the DD-WRT forums] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Linksys_WRV54G On the DD-WRT forums] *[http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/linksys/wrv54g On the OpenWrt wiki] ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===JTAG=== ====JTAG Pinouts==== J2 is definitely JTAG. It is using the 20-pin standard ARM JTAG pin layout. :Pin 1 on this header is on the edge of the board, closest to the LED. Pinout: (from Intel) 
                c[] LED5
       +3.3V -- 1 o o 2 -- NC
       nTRST -- 3 o o 4 -- GND
         TDI -- 5 o o 6 -- GND
         TMS -- 7 o o 8 -- GND
         TCK -- 9 o o 10 - GND
         GND - 11 o o 12 - GND
         TDO - 13 o o 14 - GND
      nRESET - 15 o o 16 - GND
          NC - 17 o o 18 - GND
          NC - 19 o o 20 - GND
===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== On the WRV-54G board, the 9 pins look like: 
              -----
(ttyS1 TX) 1 | 0 o | 2  +3.3V
           3 | o o | 4  +3.3V
           5 | o o | 6  GND
(ttyS1 RX) 7 | o o | 8  GND
           9 | o   |
              -----
(I've renumbered the pins to the standard pin convention for these connectors) ==Pictures==
